Recording

Once youâ€™ve developed the course curriculum, youâ€™re ready to record. Here are some tips to help you do so successfully.

Defaults

Please use defaults when you teach. This means having your RStudio set up to look like it would for a student. If you move your panels around, for example, please revert to the default when recording lessons.

Please also use default fonts while you are teaching. Pretty as they are, please donâ€™t use fonts like Fira Code, as the differences in how they render the assignment operator, for example, can be confusing for newbies.

Code Style

Please follow the tidyverse style guide as closely as possible. The most important thing is to have code that is easy to read for new learners. Youâ€™re welcome to use the styler package to format your code.

Recording Videos

For those on Mac or Windows, recording happens with Descript. David will set you up with a license so you can use it.

Getting Ready to Record

This image from Egghead is an accurate representation of what goes into making videos.

Before you record there are several things to take into consideration.

Please tidy whatever portion of your workspace will show in the background of videos. No need to go 100% Marie Kondo, but please try to keep it neat. Not only does it look more professional, it also encourages people to focus on what youâ€™re teaching, not whatever random object is on your bookshelf.

Please use an external microphone. Try to keep it as close to you as possible, though I generally try to keep it off screen.

Adjust your screen resolution. Adjusting your screen resolution makes your code much easier to read.

Working on a Mac, I go to Settings > Displays and select 1024 x 576 (HiDPI). As Egghead explains about HiDPI:

HiDPI modeâ€”also known broadly as DPI scaling, or Retina display on Macsâ€”doubles each pixel, allowing for highly readable text on very high-resolution screens.

There are some instructions for doing the same thing on Windows here.

Please hit the top menu bar when you record. Please go into full screen mode in RStudio. This hides your top menu bar and keeps the focus on your code.

Please use an external webcam. They tend to be higher quality than built-in ones.

If you are interested in learning more tips about high-quality screencasting, this guide from Egghead is helpful.

Recording Lessons in Descript

You will record videos using Descript. Itâ€™s a great tool and has extensive documentation.

Please create a new project for each lesson. Use the blue new project button, not the classic project option.

Hereâ€™s how to record a lesson.

You can re-record as much as youâ€™d like. Itâ€™s helpful if you can delete bad takes that you donâ€™t want included. Just highlight the text and hit delete.

Video Editing

Once youâ€™ve finished recording all lessons, David will then edit them.
